page.title: 01EAST BRIDGFORD
page.content: East Bridgford is a small village in a conservation area about 11 miles east of Nottingham, west of the Fosse Way- a Roman road and near the Roman remains of the fort Margidunum. In the original Domesday Book East Bridgford was called Brugeford.East Bridgford has a population of 1640.In the village there are 8 shops:-The Good Life,Butcher,The Post office,Victoria, Craft Shop,The Garden Shop, Newsagent, Hair Dresser.The Village is a comuter village and people who work in Nottingham,Newark and Leicester live in the village.There are several different houses -Cottages,Bungalows and new houses.The Present Church dates back to the 13th century. {////////////////////////////////////// //////////////////////////////////////
